description.narrative:
Grunden för projektet är enligt CRG ett stort behov av ett förnyat samhällskontrakt mellan staten och befolkningen som kan ge upphov till verkliga reformer i viktiga områden för att tillåta landet att ta sig ur våldsam konflikt och fattigdom. Detta behov kommer av det faktum att trots en fredlig maktövergång för första gången i den kongolesiska historien verkar en förändring av de verkställande och lagstiftande ledarna för närvarande inte översätta till tillhandahållandet av en bättre samhällsstyrning.
Projektet syftar till att stimulera och informera en offentlig debatt om hur en verklig, transformativ förändring skulle se ut, och i bredare bemärkelse om förhållandet mellan stat och befolkning. Detta kommer att ske genom forskning för att generera bevis på viktiga ämnen av allmänt intresse, liksom om de organisationer som ska vara broar mellan befolkningen och den regerande eliten: politiska partier och civilsamhällets organisationer. CRG kommer också att genomföra en rad enkäter som syftar till att bättre förstå allmänhetens åsikter i frågor som rör administrativ reform. Parallellt kommer ett spårningssystem att lanseras online som gör det möjligt för medborgarna att se vad deras valda representanter gör på både lagstiftnings- och verkställande nivå. Slutligen kommer resultaten av forskningen att spridas och diskuteras genom debatter organiserade över hela landet, en podcast, vanliga blogginlägg och en serie infografik och videor.
Projektets övergripande mål är att bidra till en förbättrad kvalitet av den kongolesiska demokratin genom att genomföra en rigorös forskning om politiska partier och civilsamhällets organisationer, skapa mekanismer för att stärka statens ansvar och uppmuntra aktivt deltagande från alla intressenter (inklusive fattiga, voiceless, medborgare) genom att stimulera debatter om bättre samhällsstyrning.

The rationale of the project is according to CRG a dire need for a renewed social contract between the state and the population that can produce genuine reform in key areas, to allow the country to emerge from violent conflict and crippling poverty. This need comes from the fact that in spite of a peaceful transition of power for the first time in the Congolese history, a change of the executive and legislative leaders does not appear, for the time being, to translate into the provision of better governance
The project aims to stimulate and inform public debate around what real, transformative change would look like, and on the relationship between rulers and ruled more broadly. This will take place through research to generate evidence on key topics of public interest, as well as on the organisations that are supposed to be bridges between the population and the ruling elite: political parties and civil society organizations. CRG will also conduct a series of polls that seek to better understand public sentiment on issues related to administrative reform. In parallel, they will launch an online tracking system that allows citizens to see what their elected representatives are doing at both the legislative and the executive level. Finally, the results of the research will be disseminated and discussed through debates organized across the country, a podcast, regular blog posts, and a series of infographics and videos.
The overall objective of the project is to contribute to the improvement of the quality of Congolese democracy by conducting rigorous research into political parties and civil society organizations, creating mechanisms to strengthen state accountability, and encouraging active participation of all stakeholders (including poor, voiceless citizens) by stimulating debates on better governance.

description.narrative: During the first six months of the project, the CRG has primarily been in a preparatory phase, including work on identifying a co-funder; following the establishment of CRG’s local implementing partner; beginning the recruitment process for local staff; completing most of the work to design and build the parliamentary and government tracker; and preparing the first opinion poll. The process of registering the local implementing partner “Ebuteli: Institut de recherches sur la politique et la violence” has advanced well. The organisation’s statutes and internal rules and regulations have been draftedand submitted to the relevant Congolese authorities. Ebutil is the Lingala word for stairway and refers to the proverb that the lie takes the elevator and the truth takes the stairs. It will take longer but it will eventually reach the top. The following are examples of activities during the first six months in the four activity areas respectively. 1. Analysing Spaces and Structures of Civic Mobilization Three of the reports to be published during the project period have been chosen for publication in the period between March 2021 and February 2022, on the PPRD, UDPS, and ENVOL. The CRG personnel who will be responsible for leading the research and writing for each of these three reports have been selected and the CRG have had contact with members of these parties to explain the project and request assistance in facilitating the research. 2. Tracking the Accountability of State Institutions The process of designing and developing the tracker on parliamentary activity and government action has been initiated with an external service provider. The application will initially be designed for mobile devises, identified as the main chanel through which the tracker's audience will access it. It has been named Talatala (mirror, in Lingala) and the logo is a magnifying glass, symbolising the citizen's view of their representatives. A research assistant to monitor parliamentary activity has been recruited and the data collection within the National Assembly has also begun which has allowed the CRG to build a database of the 500 national deputies, with an individual file for each elected representative. In addition, the CRG has started discussions with actualité.cd’s parliamentary desk to establish a partnership for broadcasting Talatala’s products. 3. Opinion polls The questions for the first poll have been shared with donors for their comments and are still being refined. For the polling itself, a polling company that the CRG has used on several occasions previously has been contracted. The first poll is particularly important, since it will evaluate the first two years of Tshisekedi’s term in office and establish a baseline for the rest of subsequent polls. A calendar of other polls has also been discussed with BERCI. 4. Communication Strategy As part of the project, several different communications products, podcasts and briefings, will be produced and broadcasted on a regular basis. Some of the podcasts and briefs have already been produced and broadcasted during the reporting period. In relation to an amendment foreseen of the contribution with Internews Europe, will be able to disseminate project-related audio content in four national languages to local community radio stations.
